page.title: 03 BOTHY VINEYARD
page.content: VITICULTURE is not new to the ABINGDON area;in the Middle Ages the Abbey maintained a vineyard. Bothy vineyard is in the parish of Marcham.The site was chosen for its well-drained soils,which are perfect for the deep-rooting,early-flowering german vines,giving them a balance of acidity and extract. The existing three acres were planted in 1978-79 with 4000 vines(Huxelrebe;Ortega;and Findling varieties). 1984 produced a good VINTAGE,with 6000 bottles produced(mostly local TRADE).However,because of the wet June,the owners fear a poor vintage this year. The owners R.and D.B.Fisher work the land in their spare time(weekends mostly),but are hoping to build a cottage on the site.
